src:
KPK Panggil 10 Saksi untuk Tersangka Bupati Indramayu Nonaktif Supendi
01 Nov 2019, 04:58 by Siska Nirmala
JAKARTA, (PR).- Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) memanggil 10 saksi dalam penyidikan kasus suap terkait pengaturan proyek di lingkungan Pemerintah Kabupaten Indramayu pada tahun anggaran Â 2019. Mereka dijadwalkan pada hari Jumat, 1 November 2019, diperiksa untuk tersangka Bupati Indramayu nonaktif Supendi (SP).
"Hari ini, KPK mengagendakan pemeriksaan 10 saksi untuk tersangka SP dalam tindak pidana korupsi suap tersebut," ucap Juru Bicara KPK Febri Diansyah di Jakarta, Jumat, 1 November 2019, seperti dilansir Kantor Berita Antara.
Pemeriksaan terhadap mereka dilakukan di Polres Cirebon Kota.
Sepuluh saksi itu, yakni Direktur PT Majoma Surya Abadi Mangihut H. Sitompul, Direktur CV Sumber Sedayu Badrudin, Direktur PT Wijaya Putra Parahiyangan Dadang Juhata, Direktur CV Wanara Indah Yudi Wahyudi, dan Direktur CV Putri Jaya Mandiri Jeni Arseno Sihabudin.
Selanjutnya, Direktur CV Saka Karya Nawawi Kasnadi, Direktur PT Ghissani Bangun Sejahtera Ahmad Fauzi Asmai, CV Bromo Karya Teknik Sidik, dan Staf Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Barat dan Banten Budiman.
Sebelumnya, KPK menetapkan Supendi dan tiga orang lainnya sebagai tersangka tindak pidana korupsi suap pengaturan proyek di lingkungan Pemkab Indramayu pada tahun anggaran 2019.
Selain Supendi, tiga orang lainnya, yakni Kepala Dinas PUPR Kabupaten Indramayu Omarsyah (OMS), Kepala Bidang Jalan di Dinas PUPR Kabupaten Indramayu Wempy Triyono (WT), dan Carsa AS (CAS) dari unsur swasta.
Dalam kasus tersebut, Supendi, Omarsyah, dan Wempy diduga sebagai pihak penerima suap, sedangkan Carsa sebagai pemberi.
Sebelumnya, Wakil Ketua KPK Basaria Panjaitan saat jumpa pers di Gedung KPK, Jakarta, Selasa, 15 Oktober 2019 malam, menduga Carsa memberi uang kepada Supendi dan pejabat Dinas PUPR merupakan bagian dari komitmen fee 5 sampai 7 persen dari nilai proyek.
"SP diduga menerima total Rp200 juta, yaitu pada bulan Mei 2019 sejumlah Rp100 juta untuk THR, pada tanggal 14 Oktober 2019 sejumlah Rp100 juta untuk pembayaran dalang acara wayang kulit dan pembayaran gadai sawah," ucap Basaria.
Kedua, Omarsyah diduga menerima uang total Rp350 juta dan sepeda dengan perincian dua kali pada bulan Juli 2019 sejumlah Rp150 juta, dua kali pada bulan September 2019 sejumlah Rp200 juta, dan sepeda merek NEO dengan harga sekitar Rp20 juta.
"WT diduga menerima Rp560 juta selama lima kali pada bulan Agustus dan Oktober 2019," ujar Basaria.
Uang yang diterima Omarsyah dan Wempy diduga juga untuk kepentingan Supendi, pengurusan pengamanan proyek, dan kepentingan sendiri.***

Baca Juga
text:
KPK Summons 10 Witnesses to Suspect Indramayu Regent's Supid Supendi
Nov 01 2019, 04:58 by Siska Nirmala
JAKARTA, (PR) .- The Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) summoned 10 witnesses in investigating bribery cases related to project arrangements within the Indramayu Regency Government in the 2019 fiscal year. They were scheduled on Friday, November 1, 2019, to be questioned for the suspected Regent of Indramayu inactive Supendi (SP).
"Today, the KPK has scheduled the examination of 10 witnesses for SP suspects in bribery corruption," said KPK Spokesman Febri Diansyah in Jakarta, Friday, November 1, 2019, as reported by the Antara News Agency.
The examination of them was carried out at the Cirebon City Police Station.
The ten witnesses, namely Director of PT Majoma Surya Abadi Mangihut H. Sitompul, Director of CV Sumber Sedayu Badrudin, Director of PT Wijaya Putra Parahiyangan Dadang Juhata, Director of CV Wanara Indah Yudi Wahyudi, and Director of CV Putri Jaya Mandiri Jeni Arseno Sihabudin.
Furthermore, Director of CV Saka Karya Nawawi Kasnadi, Director of PT Ghissani Bangun Sejahtera Ahmad Fauzi Asmai, CV Bromo Karya Sidik Engineering, and Staff of the West Java Regional Development Bank and Banten Budiman.
Previously, the KPK named Supendi and three others as suspects in a bribery corruption project arrangement within the Indramayu Regency Government in the 2019 fiscal year.
In addition to Supendi, three other people, namely the Head of the Indramayu Omarsyah Regency PUPR Service (OMS), the Head of the Road Sector at the Indramayu Regency PUPR Office Wempy Triyono (WT), and Carsa AS (CAS) from the private sector.
In that case, Supendi, Omarsyah and Wempy were suspected of being the recipients of the bribes, while Carsa was the giver.
Previously, KPK Deputy Chairman Basaria Panjaitan during a press conference at the KPK Building, Jakarta, Tuesday, October 15, 2019 evening, suspected that Carsa gave money to Supendi and PUPR Service officials as part of a fee commitment of 5 to 7 percent of the project value.
"SP is suspected to have received a total of Rp. 200 million, namely in May 2019 in the amount of Rp. 100 million for THR, on October 14, 2019 in the amount of Rp. 100 million for the payment of puppeteers and wayang pawn payments," Basaria said.
Secondly, Omarsyah is thought to have received a total of Rp.350 million and a bicycle with details twice in July 2019 totaling Rp150 million, twice in September 2019 amounting to Rp200 million, and NEO brand bikes at a price of around Rp20 million.
"WT is thought to have received Rp560 million five times in August and October 2019," Basaria said.
The money received by Omarsyah and Wempy is also suspected to be in the interests of Supendi, the maintenance of the project, and his own interests. ***
